channel.description: Recent content in Posts on My Website

item.title: The interconnectedness of R and Python
item.description: Python and R: Reticulate Python and R are two different yet similar languages. I would say that if you want to try and interpret data and present it in a visually appealing and igestible way then use R, but python definetily has more capabilites and options to do other things with. One fun fact is that R and python can work together to generate data and results. In the example below, I loaded the datasets "quakes" and generated a histogram in an r code chunk; however when interpreting (Calculating for mean) I used a python code, and I was stillable to gernerate results!

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
